January 21, 2020

One patient in critical condition, two patients in stable condition.

National Health Commission Update

02:09 CST (UTC+8), January 21, 2020

National Health Commission Announcement

2019-nCoV deemed Class B disease, but Class A precautions will be used

Zhejiang Province Update

10:06 CST (UTC+8), January 20, 2020

Zhejiang Province: Five potential cases in Wenzhou, Zhoushan, Taizhou, and Hangzhou. 

All patients in stable condition.

Guangdong Province Update

02:51 CST (UTC+8), January 20, 2020

Guangdong Province: One confirmed case in Shenzhen.

Patient in stable condition.

02:44 CST (UTC+8), January 20, 2020

Beijing Municipality: Two confirmed cases in Daxing District in outskirts of Beijing.

Patient in stable condition.

Wuhan Municipality, Hubei Province Update

02:42 CST (UTC+8), January 20, 2020

Wuhan Municipality: One hundred thirty-six new confirmed cases.

One additional death and three patients in critical condition.

National Health Commission Update on October 04, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, October 03, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 16 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 10 imported cases (Guangdong Province 6 cases; Sichuan Province 3 cases; Yunnan Province 2 cases; Shaanxi Province 2 cases; Tianjin Municipality 1 case; Shanghai Municipality 1 case; and Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, 3 new suspected cases (Shanghai Municipality).

On this day, 10 patients have recovered and been discharged, 272 have been released from medical observation, and patients in severe condition remained the same as the previous day.

Imported cases consist of 195 current cases (1 severe case) and 7 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,902 confirmed cases, 2,706 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, October 03, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 195 confirmed cases (1 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,621 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,450 total confirmed cases, and 7 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 835,190 individuals, and 7,439 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 26 new asymptomatic infected persons (26 imported cases) were reported, 5 have been changed into confirmed cases, 19 have been released from medical observation (19 imported cases), and 366 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (364 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,671 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5,108 total, 4,849 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (517 total, 484 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202010/8a6ac2d0e687458bb35677c7ee14b883.shtml

National Health Commission Update on October 03, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, October 02, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 10 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 10 imported cases (Shanghai Municipality 4 cases; Guangdong Province 3 cases; Sichuan Province 2 cases; and Shaanxi Province 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, 1 new suspected case (Shanghai Municipality).

On this day, 10 patients have recovered and been discharged, 801 have been released from medical observation, and patients in severe condition remained the same as the previous day.

Imported cases consist of 189 current cases (1 severe case) and 4 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,885 confirmed cases, 2,696 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, October 02, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 189 confirmed cases (1 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,611 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,434 total confirmed cases, and 4 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 834,705 individuals, and 7,227 are still under medical isolation.

On this day,12 new asymptomatic infected persons (12 imported cases) were reported, 1 has been changed into confirmed case, 24 have been released from medical observation (24 imported cases), and 364 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (362 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,667 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5,104 total, 4,843 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (517 total, 484 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202010/b2a5f2d5fa1f4cee8c57d011d38f2a35.shtml

National Health Commission Update on October 02, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, October 01, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 10 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 10 imported cases (Sichuan Province 3 cases; Fujian Province 2 cases; Guangdong Province 2 cases; Shanghai Municipality 1 case; Chongqing Municipality; and Shaanxi Province 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, no new suspected cases.

On this day, 7 patients have recovered and been discharged, 607 have been released from medical observation, and patients in severe condition remained the same as the previous day.

Imported cases consist of 189 current cases (1 severe case) and 3 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,875 confirmed cases, 2,686 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, October 01, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 189 confirmed cases (1 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,601 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,424 total confirmed cases, and 3 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 834,101 individuals, and 7,424 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 33 new asymptomatic infected persons (33 imported cases) were reported, 1 has been changed into confirmed case, 18 have been released from medical observation (18 imported cases), and 377 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (375 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,658 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5,097 total, 4,837 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (515 total, 484 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http:// http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202010/08c7b372eece40b3acaa46f03c738f69.shtml

National Health Commission Update on October 01, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, September 30, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 11 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 11 imported cases (Shanghai Municipality 7 cases; Guangdong Province 2 cases; Sichuan Province 1 case; and Shaanxi Province 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, 3 new suspected cases (Shanghai Municipality).

On this day, 16 patients have recovered and been discharged, 796 have been released from medical observation, and patients in severe condition have reduced by 1.

Imported cases consist of 186 current cases (1 severe case) and 3 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,865 confirmed cases, 2,679 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, September 30, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 186 confirmed cases (1 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,594 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,414 total confirmed cases, and 3 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 833,311 individuals, and 7,241 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 10 new asymptomatic infected persons (10 imported cases) were reported, 0 have been changed into confirmed cases, 22 have been released from medical observation (22 imported cases), and 363 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (361 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,647 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5,087 total, 4,827 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (514 total, 483 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http:// http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202010/2837d6df57f042bf8212c0846f4bc6ab.shtml

National Health Commission Update on September 30, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, September 29, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 19 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 12 imported cases (Guangdong Province 8 cases; Fujian Province 5 cases; Shanghai Municipality 2 cases; Shaanxi Province 2 cases; Henan Province 1 case; and Sichuan Province 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, and 2 new suspected cases.

On this day, 12 patients have recovered and been discharged, 671 have been released from medical observation, and the number of patients in severe condition remained the same as the previous day.

Imported cases consist of 191 current cases (2 severe cases) and 2 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,854 confirmed cases, 2,663 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, September 30, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 191 confirmed cases (2 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,578 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,403 total confirmed cases, and 2 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 832,884 individuals, and 7,610 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 22 new asymptomatic infected persons (22 imported cases) were reported, 2 have been changed into confirmed cases, 21 have been released from medical observation (21 imported cases), and 375 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (373 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,638 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5079, total, 4,807 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (513 total, 482 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202009/9015bdbd354147919d82bd84a68cd919.shtml

National Health Commission Update on September 29, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, September 28, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 12 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 12 imported cases (Shanghai Municipality 5 cases; Sichuan Province 3 cases; Shaanxi Province 3 cases; and Fujian 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, and 1 new suspected case.

On this day, 13 patients have recovered and been discharged, 254 have been released from medical observation, and the number of patients in severe condition remained the same as the previous day.

Imported cases consist of 184 current cases (2 severe cases) and 1 suspected case. An aggregated 2,835 confirmed cases, 2,651 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, September 28, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 184 confirmed cases (2 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,566 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,384 total confirmed cases, and 1 remaining suspected case. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 832,332 individuals, and 7,729 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 26 new asymptomatic infected persons (26 imported cases) were reported, 2 have been changed into confirmed cases, 15 have been released from medical observation (15 imported cases), and 376 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (374 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,634 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5075, total, 4,790 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (513 total, 482 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202009/03465726712d4b42be0f846ee2eae62c.shtml

National Health Commission Update on September 28, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, September 27, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 21 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 21 imported cases (Shanghai Municipality 10 cases; Guangdong Province 5 cases; Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region 3 cases; Fujian Province 2 cases; and Shanxi 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, and no new suspected cases.

On this day, 12 patients have recovered and been discharged, 768 have been released from medical observation, and the number of patients in severe condition has reduced by 1.

Imported cases consist of 185 current cases (2 severe cases) and 0 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,823 confirmed cases, 2,638 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, September 27, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 185 confirmed cases (2 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,553 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,372 total confirmed cases, and 0 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 831,369 individuals, and 7,020 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 14 new asymptomatic infected persons (14 imported cases) were reported, 0 have been changed into confirmed cases, 38 have been released from medical observation (38 imported cases), and 367 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (365 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,621 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5065, total, 4,786 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (510 total, 480 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqfkdt/202009/6cafe36261a5402c8b74155ba32f69bc.shtml

National Health Commission Update on September 27, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, September 26, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). On this day, 14 new cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including 14 imported cases (Liaoning Province 4 cases; Fujian Province 4 cases; Sichuan Province 3 cases; Guangdong 2 cases; and Shanghai Municipality 1 case), no new local cases, no new deaths, and no new suspected cases.

On this day, 5 patients have recovered and been discharged, 560 have been released from medical observation, and the number of patients in severe condition remained the same as the previous day.

Imported cases consist of 176 current cases (3 severe cases) and 2 suspected cases. An aggregated 2,802 confirmed cases, 2,626 who have recovered and been discharged, and 0 deaths have been reported.

On this day, September 26, 2020, the 31 PLADs and XPCC have reported a current total of 176 confirmed cases (3 severe case), an accumulated total of 80,541 patients who have recovered and been discharged, 4,634 total deaths, 85,351 total confirmed cases, and 2 remaining suspected cases. Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 830,732 individuals, and 7,160 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 26 new asymptomatic infected persons (26 imported cases) were reported, 5 has been changed into confirmed case, 30 have been released from medical observation (30 imported cases), and 391 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (389 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,615 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (5059, total, 4,777 patients have been discharged, and 105 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (510 total, 480 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

Medical contact tracing has followed-up with 821,120 individuals, and 6,709 are still under medical isolation.

On this day, 22 new asymptomatic infected persons (22 imported cases) were reported, 0 have been changed into confirmed cases, 11 have been released from medical observation (11 imported cases), and 311 asymptomatic infected persons are still under medical observation (309 imported cases).

The NHC has received 5,455 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (4,913 total, 4,582 patients have been discharged, and 99 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (496 total, 475 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

The NHC has received 5,243 confirmed reports from Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (4,710 total, 4,108 patients have been discharged, and 78 deaths); Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 total and 46 patients have been discharged); and Taiwan, China (487 total, 457 patients have been discharged, and 7 deaths).

National Health Commission Update on August 10, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, August 9, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). An accumulated total of 84,668 cases were confirmed in the mainland of China, including a current total of 802 cases (41 severe case), 79,232 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 4,634 deaths. An additional total of 7 suspected cases were reported.

On this day, 49 new confirmed cases (14 in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region and 35 imported from outside the mainland of China including 18 in Shanghai Municipality, 4 in Shandong Province, 4 in Sichuan Province, 3 in Guangdong Province, 3 in Shaanxi Province, 2 in Liaoning Province, and 1 in Zhejiang Province), 0 new deaths, and 1 new suspected case (1 imported from outside the mainland of China in Shanghai Municipality) were reported. A total of 64 new patients have recovered and have been discharged, 2,305 have been released from medical observation, and the severe cases were reduced by 2.

On this day, 31 new asymptomatic infected persons (24 imported from outside the mainland of China) were reported, 3 changed into confirmed cases (3 imported from outside the mainland of China), and 15 have been released from medical observation (4 imported from outside the mainland of China). Furthermore, 283 asymptomatic infected persons are under medical observation (136 imported from outside the mainland of China).

An accumulated total of 2,169 cases were imported from outside the mainland of China, including a current total of 132 cases (1 severe cases), 2,037 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 0 deaths. An additional total of 7 suspected cases were reported.

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 4,079 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (2,847 patients have been discharged and 47 deaths), 46 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 patients have been discharged), and 477 in Taiwan, China (441 patients have been discharged and 7 deaths).

Currently, 800,809 close contacts have been followed-up with, and 24,055 are still under medical observation.

An accumulated total of 2,045 cases were imported from outside the mainland of China, including a current total of 82 cases (2 severe cases), 1,963 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 0 deaths. An additional total of 3 suspected cases were reported.

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 2,505 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (1,455 patients have been discharged and 18 deaths), 46 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (46 patients have been discharged), and 458 in Taiwan, China (440 patients have been discharged and 7 deaths).

Currently, 779,000 close contacts have been followed-up with, and 11,762 are still under medical observation.

Furthermore, 113 asymptomatic infected persons are under medical observation (82 imported from outside the mainland of China).

An accumulated total of 1,962 cases were imported from outside the mainland of China, including a current total of 71 cases (0 severe cases), 1,891 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 0 deaths. An additional total of 5 suspected cases were reported.

A total of 10 new patients have recovered and have been discharged, 396 have been released from medical observation, and no change for severe cases.

On this day, 21 new asymptomatic infected persons (2 imported from outside the mainland of China) were reported, 1 changed into confirmed case(1 imported from outside the mainland of China), and 47 have been released from medical observation (2 imported from outside the mainland of China). Furthermore, 174 asymptomatic infected persons are under medical observation (43 imported from outside the mainland of China).

An accumulated total of 1,783 cases were imported from outside the mainland of China, including a current total of 57 cases (0 severe cases), 1,783 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 0 deaths. An additional total of 1 suspected cases were reported.

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 1,107 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (1,049 patients have been discharged and 4 deaths), 45 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (45 patients have been discharged), and 443 in Taiwan, China (430 patients have been discharged and 7 deaths).

Currently, 747,232 close contacts have been followed-up with, and 2,971 are still under medical observation.

National Health Commission Update on February 29, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, February 28, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). An accumulated total of 79,251 cases were confirmed in China, including a current total of 37,414 cases (7,664 severe cases), 39,002 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 2,835 deaths. An additional total of 1,418 suspected cases were reported.

On this day, 427 new cases were confirmed in 31 PLADs and XPCC including 47 new deaths (45 in Hubei Province, 1 each in Beijing Municipality and Henan Province). A total of 2,885 new patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 10,193 have been released from medical observation, and severe cases were reduced by 288. Furthermore, 248 new suspected cases were reported.

There were 423 newly confirmed cases in Hubei Province (420 in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province), 2,429 newly cured cases (1,726 in Wuhan), 45 new deaths (37 in Wuhan), and a current total of 34,715 confirmed cases (28,836 in Wuhan) including 7,370 severe cases (6,585 in Wuhan). A total of 28,895 (17,552 in Wuhan) patients who have recovered and have been discharged, a total of 2,727 deaths (2,169 in Wuhan), and an accumulated total of 66,337 confirmed cases (48,557 in Wuhan). There were 159 new suspected cases (114 in Wuhan) and a current total of 1,171 suspected cases (788 in Wuhan).

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 94 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (30 patients have been discharged and 2 death), 10 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (8 patients have been discharged), and 34 in Taiwan, China (9 patients have been discharged and 1 death).

Currently, 658,587 close contacts have been followed-up with, and 58,233 are still under medical observation.

Source:  http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqtb/202002/4ef8b5221b4d4740bda3145ac37e68ed.shtml

An additional total of 5,365 suspected cases were reported.

An accumulated total of 75,002 cases were confirmed, and 16,157 patients have recovered and have been discharged. On February 20, an accumulated total of 75,891 cases were confirmed and 18,266 patients have recovered and have been discharged.

National Health Commission Update on February 15, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, February 14, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). An accumulated total of 66,492 cases were confirmed in China, including a current total of 56,873 cases (11,053 severe cases), 8,096 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 1,523 deaths. An additional total of 8,969 suspected cases were reported.

On this day, 2,641 new cases were confirmed in 31 PLADs and XPCC including 143 new deaths (139 in Hubei Province, 2 in Henan Province, and 1 each in Beijing and Chongqing municipalities). A total of 1,373 new patients have recovered and have been discharged, and 30,081 have been released from medical observation. Furthermore, 2,277 new suspected cases were reported.

There were 2,420 newly confirmed cases in Hubei Province (1,923 in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province), 912 newly cured cases (486 in Wuhan), 139 new deaths (107 in Wuhan), and a current total of 48,175 confirmed cases (34,289 in Wuhan) including 10,152 severe cases (8,335 in Wuhan). A total of 4,774 (2,502 in Wuhan) patients have recovered and have been discharged, a total of 1,457 deaths (1,123 in Wuhan), and an accumulated total of 54,406 confirmed cases (37,914 in Wuhan). There were 1,216 new suspected cases (507 in Wuhan) and a current total of 5,534 suspected cases (2,265 in Wuhan).

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 56 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (1 patient has been discharged and 1 death), 10 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (3 patients have been discharged), and 18 in Taiwan, China (1 patient has been discharged). 

Currently, 513,183 close contacts have been followed-up with, and 169,039 are still under medical observation.

Source:  http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqtb/202002/50994e4df10c49c199ce6db07e196b61.shtml


National Health Commission Update on February 14, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, February 13, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). An accumulated total of 63,851 cases were confirmed in China, including a current total of 55,748 cases (10,204 severe cases), 6,723 patients who have recovered and have been discharged (of which Hubei Province has reexamined and reduced the number of reports by 269), and 1,380 deaths (of which Hubei Province has reexamined and reduced the number of reports by 108). An additional total of 10,109 suspected cases were reported.

On this day, 5,090 new cases were confirmed in 31 PLADs and XPCC including 121 new deaths (116 in Hubei Province, 2 in Heilongjiang Province, and 1 each in Anhui Province, Henan Province, and Chongqing Municipality). A total of 1,081 new patients have recovered and have been discharged. Furthermore, 2,450 new suspected cases were reported.

There were 4,823 newly confirmed cases in Hubei Province (3,910 in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province), 690 newly cured cases (370 in Wuhan), 116 new deaths (88 in Wuhan), and a current total of 46,806 confirmed cases (32,959 in Wuhan) including 9,278 severe cases (7,492 in Wuhan). A total of 3,862 (2,016 in Wuhan) patients have recovered and have been discharged, a total of 1,318 deaths (1,016 in Wuhan), and an accumulated total of 51,986 confirmed cases (35,991 in Wuhan). There were 1,154 new suspected cases (473 in Wuhan) and a current total of 6,169 suspected cases (2,585 in Wuhan).

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 53 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (1 patient has been discharged and 1 death), 10 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (3 patients have been discharged), and 18 in Taiwan, China (1 patient has been discharged). 

Currently, 493,067 close contacts have been followed-up with, 26,905 have been released from medical observation, and 177,984 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqtb/202002/553ff43ca29d4fe88f3837d49d6b6ef1.shtml


National Health Commission Update on February 13, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, February 12, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 31 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) and Xinjiang Production and Construction Corp (XPCC) of COVID-19, formerly referred to as novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP). An accumulated total of 59,804 cases were confirmed in China, including a current total of 52,526 cases (8,030 severe cases), 5,911 patients who have recovered and have been discharged, and 1,367 deaths. An additional total of 13,435 suspected cases were reported.

On this day, 15,152 new cases were confirmed in 31 PLADs and XPCC (13,332 were clinically diagnosed in Hubei Province) including 254 new deaths (242 in Hubei Province, 2 in Henan Province, and 1 each in Tianjin Municipality, Hebei Province, Liaoning Province, Heilongjiang Province, Anhui Province, Shandong Province, Guangdong Province, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Hainan Province, and XPCC). A total of 1,171 new patients have recovered and have been discharged. Furthermore, 2,807 new suspected cases were reported.

There were 14,840 newly confirmed cases in Hubei Province (13,436 in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province), 802 newly cured cases (538 in Wuhan), 242 new deaths (216 in Wuhan), and a current total of 43,455 confirmed cases (30,043 in Wuhan) including 7,084 severe cases (5,426 in Wuhan). A total of 3,441 (1,915 in Wuhan) patients have recovered and have been discharged, a total of 1,310 deaths (1,036 in Wuhan), and an accumulated total of 48,206 confirmed cases (32,994 in Wuhan). There were 1,377 new suspected cases (620 in Wuhan) and a current total of 9,028 suspected cases (4,904 in Wuhan).

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 50 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China (1 patient has been discharged and 1 death), 10 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China (1 patient has been discharged), and 18 in Taiwan, China (1 patient has been discharged). 

Currently, 471,531 close contacts have been followed-up with, 29,429 have been released from medical observation, and 181,386 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/yqtb/202002/26fb16805f024382bff1de80c918368f.shtml

National Health Commission Update on January 26, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, January 25, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 3r0 povincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) of novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (NCIP). A total of 1,975 cases were confirmed in China including 324 severe cases and 56 deaths. A total of 49 patients have recovered and have been discharged. An additional total of 2,684 suspected cases were reported.

On this day, 688 new cases were confirmed in 29 PLADs including 87 new severe cases, and 15 new deaths—13 in Hubei Province, 1 in Shanghai, and 1 in Henan. A total of 11 new patients have recovered and have been discharged. Furthermore, 1,309 new suspected cases were reported.

The NHC has received confirmed reports including a total of 5 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China, 2 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China, and 3 in Taiwan, China. Furthermore, confirmed reports also include a total of 4 in Thailand (2 recovered), 2 in Japan (1 recovered), 2 in Republic of Korea, 2 in the United States of America, 2 in Vietnam, 3 in Singapore, 3 in Malaysia, 1 in Nepal, 3 in France, and 1 in Australia.

Currently, 23,431 close contacts have been followed-up with, 325 have been released from medical observation, and 21,556 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/yjb/s7860/202001/9614b05a8cac4ffabac10c4502fe517c.shtml


National Health Commission Update on January 25, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, January 24, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 29 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) of novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (NCIP). A total of 1,287 cases were confirmed in 29 PLADs in China including 237 severe cases and 41 deaths—39 in Hubei Province where Wuhan is the capital, 1 in Hebei Province, and 1 in Heilongjiang Province. A total of 38 patients have recovered and have been discharged. An additional total of 1,965 suspected cases were reported in 20 PLADs.

On this day, 444 new cases and 16 new deaths were confirmed in 29 PLADs. A total of 3 new patients have recovered and have been discharged. Furthermore, 1,118 new suspected cases were reported in 19 PLADs. Overall, 30 PLADs reported epidemics nationwide, and Qinghai Province was newly added.

The NHC has received reports of 5 cases including 5 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China, 2 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China, and 3 in Taiwan, China. In addition, 18 additional reports were confirmed including 2 in the United States of America, 2 in Japan (1 recovered), 4 in Thailand (2 recovered), 2 in Republic of Korea, 2 in Vietnam, 3 in Singapore, 1 in Nepal, and 2 in France.

Currently, 15,197 close contacts have been followed-up with, 1,230 have been released from medical observation, and 13,967 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/yjb/s7860/202001/a7cf0437d1324aed9cc1b890b8ee29e6.shtml


National Health Commission Update on January 24, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, January 23, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 27 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) of novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (NCIP). A total of 830 cases were confirmed in 29 PLADs in China including 177 severe cases and 25 deaths—24 in Hubei Province where Wuhan is the capital, and 1 in Hebei Province. An additional total of 1,072 suspected cases were reported in 20 PLADs.

On this day, 259 new cases and 8 new deaths were confirmed in 24 PLADs. A total of 6 new patients have recovered and have been discharged. Furthermore, 680 new suspected cases were reported in 19 PLADs. Overall, 29 PLADs reported epidemics nationwide, and 4 PLADs were newly added including Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, Shaanxi Province, Gansu Province, and Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region.

The NHC has received reports of 5 cases including 2 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China, 2 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China, and 1 in Taiwan, China. In addition, 9 additional reports were confirmed including 1 in the United States of America, 1 in Japan (recovered), 3 in Thailand (2 recovered), 1 in Republic of Korea, 2 in Vietnam, and 1 in Singapore.

Currently, 9,507 close contacts have been followed-up with, 1,087 have been released from medical observation, and 8,420 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/yjb/s3578/202001/c5da49c4c5bf4bcfb320ec2036480627.shtml



National Health Commission Update on January 23, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, January 22, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 25 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) of novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (NCIP). A total of 571 cases were confirmed in 25 PLADs in China including 95 severe cases and 17 deaths—all in Hubei Province where Wuhan is the capital. An additional total of 393 suspected cases were reported in 13 PLADs.

On this day, 131 new cases and 8 new deaths were confirmed in 24 PLADs. Of these 8 new deaths, 5 were males and 3 were females, and except for a 53-year-old patient, the rest were over 65 years old with 5 exceeding 80 years of age and had suffered from chronic and basic diseases such as recovery from postoperative cancer, liver damage, hypertension, coronary heart disease, diabetes, and Parkinson’s disease. Furthermore, 257 new suspected cases were reported in 13 PLADs. Overall, 25 PLADs reported epidemics nationwide, and 4 PLADs were newly added including Hebei Province, Liaoning Province, Jiangsu Province, and Fujian Province.

The NHC has received additional reports of 9 confirmed cases including 1 in Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China, 1 in Macau Special Administrative Region, China, 1 in Taiwan, China, 1 in the United States of America, 1 in Japan, 3 in Thailand, and 1 in Republic of Korea.

Currently, 5,897 close contacts have been followed-up with, 969 have been released from medical observation, and 4,928 are still under medical observation.

Editor’s Note: Details on the 17 deaths are provided in the official report and will be added to Tracking the Epidemic as they are translated.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/yjb/s3578/202001/5d19a4f6d3154b9fae328918ed2e3c8a.shtml?from=timeline&isappinstalled=0


National Health Commission Update on January 22, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, January 21, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received confirmed reports from 13 provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) of novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (NCIP).

On this day, 149 new cases were confirmed in 13 PLADs including 5 in Beijing Municipality, 2 in Tianjin Municipality, 5 in Shanghai Municipality, 5 in Zhejiang Province, 2 in Jiangxi Province, 1 in Shandong Province, 1 in Henan Province, 105 in Hubei Province (Wuhan is in Hubei Province), 1 in Hunan Province, 12 in Guangdong Province, 5 in Chongqing Municipality, 2 in Sichuan Province, and 1 in Yunnan Province. In addition, 3 more deaths were reported—all from Hubei Province. Outside of Hubei Province, 26 suspected cases were reported in 6 provinces including 10 in Shanghai Municipality, 10 in Zhejiang Province, 2 in Anhui Province, 1 in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, 1 in Guangdong Province, and 2 in Sichuan Province.

As of 23:59, January 21, 2020, the NHC has received a total of 440 confirmed cases of NCIP from 13 PLADs including a total of 10 in Beijing Municipality, 2 in Tianjin Municipality, 9 in Shanghai Municipality, 5 in Zhejiang Province, 2 in Jiangxi Province, 1 in Shandong Province, 1 in Henan Province, 375 in Hubei Province, 1 in Hunan Province, 26 in Guangdong Province, 5 in Chongqing Municipality, 2 in Sichuan Province, and 1 in Yunnan Province. Of these confirmed cases, 102 were in crucial condition and 9 deaths occurred—all from Hubei Province. In total outside of Hubei Province, 37 suspected cases remain in 12 PLADs including 1 in Shanxi Province, 1 in Jilin Province, 1 in Heilongjiang, 10 in Shanghai Municipality, 10 in Zhejiang Province, 3 in Anhui Province, 1 in Guangdong Province, 2 in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, 1 in Hainan Province, 5 in Sichuan Province, 1 in Guizhou Province, and 1 in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region. 

The NHC has received reports of 5 confirmed international cases including 1 in Japan, 3 in Thailand, and 1 in Republic of Korea.

Currently, 2,197 close contacts have been followed-up with, 765 have been released from medical observation, and 1,394 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/yjb/s3578/202001/a3c8b5144067417889d8760254b1a7ca.shtml


National Health Commission Update on January 21, 2020

From 00:00 to 23:59, January 20, 2020, the National Health Commission (NHC) received reports from three provincial-level administrative divisions (PLADs) of novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (NCIP).

On this day, 77 new cases were confirmed in 3 PLADs including 72 in Hubei Province (Wuhan is in Hubei Province), 2 in Shanghai Municipality, and 3 in Beijing Municipality. In addition, 27 suspected cases were reported including 4 in Guangdong Province, 1 in Sichuan Province, 1 in Yunnan Province, 7 in Shanghai Municipality, 10 in Zhejiang Province, 1 in Anhui Province, 1 in Hainan Province, 1 in Guizhou Province, and 1 in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region.

As of 23:59, January 20, 2020, the NHC has received a total of 291 confirmed cases of NCIP from 4 PLADs including a total of 270 cases in Hubei Province, 5 in Beijing Municipality, 14 in Guangdong Province, and 2 in Shanghai Municipality. In total, 54 suspected cases remain in 14 PLADs including 11 cases in Hubei Province, 7 in Guangdong Province, 3 in Sichuan, 1 in Yunnan Province, 7 in Shanghai Municipality, 1 in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, 1 in Shandong Province, 1 in Jilin Province, 1 in Anhui Province, 16 in Zhejiang Province, 2 in Jiangxi Province, 1 in Hainan Province, 1 in Guizhou Province, and 1 in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region.

The NHC has received reports of 4 confirmed international cases including 1 in Japan, 2 in Thailand, and 1 in Republic of Korea.

Currently, 1,739 close contacts have been followed-up with, 817 have been released from medical observation, and 922 are still under medical observation.

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/yjb/s3578/202001/930c021cdd1f46dc832fc27e0cc465c8.shtml


Beijing Municipality Update

January 20, 2020, the Beijing Municipal Health Commission has reported 3 new cases of pneumonia confirmed to be related to the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. Two patients are in stable condition, and one patient is in critical condition. All three are receiving isolated medical treatment at designated hospitals. A total of 23 close contacts have been placed under medical observation and no abnormalities have been detected.

Two male patients had separate short visits to Wuhan on January 7 and January 9 and experienced onset of fever and respiratory symptoms on January 13 and January 14, respectively. An elderly female patient from Wuhan also came to Beijing to visit relatives and developed similar symptoms on January 13. Based on clinical symptoms, epidemiological investigation, evaluation by an expert group, and testing by the China CDC, these patients were confirmed to have cases of pneumonia related to the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. 

As of 18:00 CST (UTC+8), January 20, 2020, 5 total cases of were confirmed in Beijing Municipality.

Source: http://wjw.beijing.gov.cn/xwzx_20031/wnxw/202001/t20200120_1619533.html 


Shandong Province Update

January 20, 2020, the Health Commission of Shandong Province has reported a suspected case of pneumonia potentially related to the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. This case has appeared in Qingdao Municipality. The patient is in stable condition and receiving isolated medical treatment at a designated hospital. Close contacts have been placed under medical observation. Test results are still being verified according to national regulations and will be reported as soon as possible.

The Shandong Provincial Party Committee and the Provincial Government are thoroughly implementing General Secretary Xi Jinping and Premier Li Keqiang’s instructions to prioritize the lives of the people and their physical health through the prevention and control of pneumonia related to the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV. All departments are working simultaneously on prevention and control, and the health system is continuously being improved through strengthening staff training; strengthening stores of materials, equipment, and drugs; and comprehensively completing the work needed for epidemic prevention and control. 

In the next steps, health commissions will continue to do with full effort for the prevention and control of epidemics and case treatment to effectively protect the lives of the people.

Source: http://wsjkw.shandong.gov.cn/wzxxgk/zwgg/202001/t20200121_2510263.html


National Health Commission Update

With approval from the State Council, the National Health Commission announces the following:

1)Pneumonia related to the new type of coronavirus (2019-nCoV) shall be categorized as a Class B infectious disease as stipulated by the Law of the People’s Republic of China on the Prevention and Treatment of Infectious Diseases, and prevention and control measures for Class A infectious diseases shall be adopted. 

2)The 2019-nCoV will be incorporated in the management of infectious diseases as stipulated in the Law of the People’s Republic of China on Frontier Health and Quarantine. 

Source: http://www.nhc.gov.cn/jkj/s7916/202001/44a3b8245e8049d2837a4f27529cd386.shtml


Zhejiang Province Update

January 20, 2020 at 10:06 CST (UTC+8), the Health Commission of Zhejiang Province has reported 5 total cases of respiratory symptoms and fever potentially related to the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. These cases have appeared in the municipalities of Wenzhou, Zhoushan, Taizhou, and Hangzhou. The five patients are all in stable condition and receiving isolated medical treatment at designated hospitals. Close contacts have been placed under medical observation. Test results are still being verified and will be reported as soon as possible.

Following the National Health Commission’s announcement of the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV, Zhejiang Province has prioritized the prevention and control of infectious pneumonia. Following directives from the Zhejiang Provincial Party Committee and Zhejiang Provincial Government, health departments responded quickly and comprehensively by setting up special expert working groups to quickly formulate emergency measures and action plans. Healthcare facilities and disease prevention and control centers within the province are allocating resources for prescreening and triaging fevers within clinics and standardizing the surveillance, diagnosis, and treatment of suspicious cases. Furthermore, patriotic health campaigns, environmental improvement, and management of farmers’ markets have been initiated throughout the province.

Source: http://www.zjwjw.gov.cn/art/2020/1/20/art_1202194_41763416.html


Guangdong Province Update

January 20, 2020 at 02:51 CST (UTC+8), the Health Commission of Guangdong has been notified by the National Health Commission that a case of pneumonia in Shenzhen has been confirmed to result from the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. The patient is in stable condition.

The patient is a 66-year-old male who currently lives in Shenzhen. He went to visit relatives in Wuhan on December 29, 2019 and began experiencing onset of fever and fatigue on January 3, 2020. He returned to Shenzhen on January 4 and was admitted to a designated hospital on January 11 for isolated medical treatment. Provincial and municipal centers for disease control (CDCs) confirmed the case’s relation to the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV using optimized reagent test kits.

On January 18, specimens were verified by China CDC using viral nucleic acid review testing. On January 19, the case was evaluated and confirmed by diagnostic experts of the National Health Commission’s Epidemic Leadership Group according to the contents of the “New Coronavirus-Related Pneumonia Diagnosis and Treatment Plan (Version 2)”. 

Experts judged that the current epidemic situation is still preventable and controllable. Guangdong Province is currently implementing several prevention and control measures including conducting follow-ups with close contacts and in-depth epidemiological investigations; intensifying pre-examination and triage of fever in clinics; standardizing the monitoring, screening, diagnosis, and treatment of suspicious cases; initiating patriotic health campaigns; strengthening environmental improvements and management of farmers’ markets; and banning illegal wildlife sales. Experts believe that the current epidemic situation is still preventable and controllable. 

Source: http://wsjkw.gd.gov.cn/zwyw_yqxx/content/post_2876057.html


Daxing District, Beijing Municipality Update

January 20, 2020 at 02:44 CST (UTC+8), the Health Committee of Daxing District has reported that 2 new cases of pneumonia have been confirmed as the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. Daxing District lies at the southern border of Beijing.

Based on clinical symptoms and epidemiological investigation, the two fever patients had a history of travel to Wuhan and were admitted to healthcare facilities within Daxing District; they were later confirmed to have the 2019-nCoV by Chinese Center of Disease Control and Prevention (China CDC). These two patients have no respiratory symptoms and are in stable condition as they receive isolated medical treatment at designated hospitals. Daxing District is conducting medical observations on close contacts, and no abnormalities such as fever have been observed.

Source: https://weibo.com/2703012010/IqhwfsbDU


Wuhan Municipality, Hubei Province Update

January 20, 2020 at 02:42 CST (UTC+8), the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission has provided updates on new cases of pneumonia confirmed as the Wuhan coronavirus 2019-nCoV. On January 18, 5 patients have recovered and were discharged from their respective hospitals, and 59 new cases and 1 death were reported. On January 19, 1 patient has recovered and was discharged, and 77 new cases were reported.

Wuhan Municipality has further increased screening of suspected cases of pneumonia related to the emerging coronavirus to comply with new guidelines for diagnosis and treatment. These guidelines aim to further improve screening capabilities and optimize and accelerate the detection process. National, provincial, and municipal expert groups have made comprehensive investigations on the disease’s clinical manifestations, epidemiological history, and pathogenic test results. 

Of the 136 total new cases reported from January 18 to January 19, 66 were male and 70 were female; the youngest was 25 years old and the oldest was 89 years old; and onset of symptoms appeared before January 18. The first symptoms to emerge were mostly fever, cough, chest tightness, and shortness of breath (dyspnea). According to the newly revised diagnosis and treatment plan, patients were classified according to their severity including 100 mild cases, 33 severe cases, and 3 critical cases, of which there was 1 death.

As of January 19, 22:00 CST (UTC+8), 198 total cases of pneumonia of the new coronavirus have been reported in Wuhan, and 25 patients have recovered and been discharged, while 3 patients have died. Currently, 170 patients are still being treated in the hospital, in which 126 cases are mild, 35 cases are severe, and 9 cases are critical. They are all under isolated treatment at designated medical institutions in Wuhan. A total of 817 close contacts have been placed under medical observation, of which 727 have been cleared and 90 remain. Among the close contacts, no related cases were found.

Source: http://wjw.wuhan.gov.cn/front/web/showDetail/2020012009077

National Health Commission Update on May 24, 2020
